pageContext.desc: A magistrate in Kittery, Maine, to the lieutenant governor of Massachusetts, William Stoughton, who was then acting governor of the province, concerning the dispatch of soldiers and Indians against the French.
transcription:
May it pleas yor honr/   Kittery this 23 of Decembr 1694
These are to informe you, that this morninge raine? in the long lookunclear for sloope
designe? God willinge to morrow morninge to take out of her what is to be landed
unclear and to putt
pageContext.category: Letters (Correspondence); Records (Documents); Indians of North America; Edward E. Ayer Manuscript Collection
pageContext.title: Francis Hooke letters, 1694
